title: Thrilling Super Bowl Spot for Kosinski's 'F1' Movie Featuring Brad Pitt
description: "Hayes attacks 'round the outside!!" Warner Bros + Apple TV have revealed their 30-second TV spot for the Super Bowl promoting the movie F1 - the Formula One racing movie starring Brad Pitt as a famous driver. F1 is the thrilling new movie from Joe Kosinski (of Tron: Legacy, Oblivion, Top Gun: Maverick) arriving in theaters this June. text: by February 9, 2025Source: YouTube "Hayes attacks 'round the outside!!" Warner Bros + Apple TV have revealed their 30-second TV spot for the Super Bowl promoting the movie F1 - the Formula One racing movie starring Brad Pitt as a famous driver. F1 is the thrilling new movie from Joe Kosinski (of Tron: Legacy, Oblivion, Top Gun: Maverick) arriving in theaters this June. The first teaser trailer debuted last summer a whole year before the scheduled release date. Now there's just five months to go until this is out in theaters 'round the world. F1 is about a legendary Formula One driver who, after a horrific crash years ago, comes out of retirement to mentor and team with a younger driver - played by Damson Idris. (That just sounds like Top Gun: Maverick again but with race cars.) F1 stars Brad Pitt as Sonny Hayes, with Idris, Kerry Condon, Tobias Menzies, Javier Bardem, Sarah Niles, plus Lewis Hamilton, Max Verstappen, and the rest of the F1 drivers & team members as themselves. This footage is exciting! And it's starting to look and feel like the Wachowskis' Speed Racer, proving how ahead of its time it was. This is going to be a must see in theaters experience! Buckle up, folks. Here's the thrilling 30-second Super Bowl TV spot for Joseph Kosinski's F1 movie, direct from YouTube: You can rewatch the first teaser trailer for Kosinski's F1 movie right here, for the first look footage again. Sonny Hayes (Brad Pitt), a Formula One driver who raced in the 1990s, has a horrible crash, forcing him to retire from Formula One and start racing in other disciplines. A Formula One team owner and friend contacts Hayes and asks him to come out of retirement to mentor rookie prodigy Joshua Pearce (Damson Idris) on the Apex Grand Prix team (APXGP). F1, also known as Formula 1, is directed by the visionary American filmmaker Joe Kosinski (aka Joseph Kosinski), director of the movies Tron: Legacy, Oblivion, Only the Brave, and Top Gun: Maverick previously, plus a few other music videos and lots of commercials. The screenplay is written by Ehren Kruger (writer of Arlington Road, Scream 3, Reindeer Games, The Ring, Blood & Chocolate, Transformers 2 - 4, Ghost in the Shell, Dumbo, Top Gun: Maverick). Produced by Jerry Bruckheimer, Chad Oman, Brad Pitt, Dede Gardner, Jeremy Kleiner, Lewis Hamilton, and Kosinski. Made by Apple Studios, Bruckheimer Films, Plan B, Dawn Apollo Films. Apple + Warner Bros opens Kosinski's F1 movie in theaters worldwide starting June 27th, 2025 - racing your way this summer. Who's excited for it? Find more posts in: Hype, To Watch, Trailer, TV Spots
